intro: Columnea macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered flame bell, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Columnea macrocalyx is also appreciated for its ability to produce vibrant, long-lasting blooms throughout the growing season.
